Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) from the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, fabric is relatively coarse and black in section, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a red/brown slip and scored in places, with remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a list of persons.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.129-30)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87642) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87642)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 157 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
